meanings.definition: Relating to or involving a catalyst.
meanings.sent1: The catalatic substance sped up the chemical reaction in the lab.
meanings.sent2: The scientist added a catalatic element to the mixture to make it react faster.
meanings.sent3: The catalatic compound was like a magical potion that made things happen quickly.
meanings.sent4: Her presence had a catalatic effect on the team, inspiring them to work harder.
meanings.sent5: The catalatic nature of the enzyme made it essential for the process to proceed smoothly.

meanings.definition: Having the properties of a catalyst.
meanings.sent1: The catalatic nature of the substance made it perfect for speeding up reactions.
meanings.sent2: The catalatic compound was known for its ability to kickstart chemical changes.
meanings.sent3: The catalatic powder seemed to have a magical touch, making things happen faster.
meanings.sent4: Her words acted as a catalatic force, sparking new ideas in the team.
meanings.sent5: The catalatic effect of the catalyst was evident in the rapid transformation of the solution.

meanings.sent1: The catalatic agent triggered a series of events that led to the desired outcome.
meanings.sent2: The catalatic substance initiated a chain reaction in the experiment.
meanings.sent3: The catalatic solution seemed to have a mischievous personality, always stirring things up.
meanings.sent4: His words had a catalatic impact on her decision, prompting her to take action.
meanings.sent5: The catalatic effect of the catalyst was like a spark that ignited the entire process.
